page.title: 05A DAY AT BLACKO SCHOOL (2)
page.content: Then the junior children got their maths books ready for S.M.P., a system of cards which allows children to progress at their own level. After this, time to make a diary report.Many children wrote about the F.A.Cup Final - Manchester United beat Everton! Playtime 10.30 - 11.00. Diaries to finish and a group using the computer - computers should be in every Primary School in the country by the end of 1985! Dinner time now, hands to wash and time to change desks into dining tables. Some children eat sandwiches but most eat a school dinner of fish and chips, a biscuit to follow.A sunny day, so playtime on the Recreation Ground follows. Afternoon session begins at 1.15 - a story to write, pottery,needlework and baking, thanks to parents helping. This is what makes a typical day.
